message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.CR, cs.NE 

The paper proposes a method to increase the robustness of deep convolutional neural networks to adversarial perturbations in image classification and segmentation tasks. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition). The method involves learning a Mahalanobis-like distance function and mapping the convolutional features onto a linearly well-separated manifold, which suggests that it may also fall under the sub-categories of cs.LG (Machine Learning) and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). The paper also evaluates the robustness of the proposed method to different types of attacks, which may place it under the sub-category of cs.CR (Cryptography and Security). Finally, the use of non-linear radial basis convolutional feature mapping suggests that it may also belong to the sub-category of cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing).
